definition: book or record/registry/roll/place of one's family or ancestral records/membership

sentences.english: If you're wondering how to lose weight, you're better off being kept in the dark。
sentences.chinese: 如果你想得到减肥秘籍，最好一直呆在黑暗里。

sentences.english: The clarity of the beef broth is the way to check if the beef noodles are authentic.
sentences.chinese: 牛肉汤的清与浊是检验牛肉面是否正宗的秘籍之一。

sentences.english: Today is the first day Zhou Benchi begins to learn the magic"Wulitou English".
sentences.chinese: 周奔驰在初学《无厘头英语》绝世武功秘籍第一天。

sentences.english: Are there any true secrets of the self-made?
sentences.chinese: 有没有自我奋斗的成功秘籍？

definition: secret book or collection of books
canonical text/treasury (i.e. book of treasured wisdom)
a trick/an ingenious method/know-how/the knack (of doing sth)
the key trick/the secret of success
what one has learned (through experience, reading etc)/knowledge/insight/understanding/tips/CL:項|项[xiang4],個|个[ge4]
crash (course)/accelerated (process)/quick (fix)/instant (success)/to achieve in a short time
mnemonic chant/rhyme for remembering (arithmetic tables, character stroke order etc)
to take down (in writing)/notes/a type of literature consisting mainly of short sketches/CL:本[ben3]
